title: Generative Video Semantic Communication via Multimodal Semantic Fusion with Large Model
author: Hang Yin (Beijing Institute of Technology), Li Qiao (Beijing Institute of Technology), Yu Ma (Beijing Institute of Technology), Shuo Sun (Beijing Institute of Technology), Kan Li (Beijing Institute of Technology), Zhen Gao (Beijing Institute of Technology), Dusit Niyato (Nanyang Technological University)
relevance_why: The paper discusses generative models and multimodal semantic communication, which could inspire methods for audio generation or enhancement by leveraging high-level semantics, similar to how audio-visual elements can be combined in Haohe Liu's research.
background: The task involves transmitting video semantics using advanced communication frameworks to achieve high-quality reconstruction even at ultra-low bandwidths.
contribution: This paper introduces the Generative Video Semantic Communication (GVSC) framework to solve video transmission challenges in bandwidth-constrained environments, achieving high semantic video reconstruction quality.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods struggle with rate-distortion theory and often require high bandwidth to maintain video quality.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by utilizing generative artificial intelligence models along with multimodal semantic fusion to enhance video reconstruction from limited transmitted information.

key_innovation: The framework uniquely combines visual and textual semantic information through advanced generative models to reconstruct video content effectively.
real_world_impact: The approach offers potential for significant advancements in low-bandwidth video transmission applications, such as remote communication and immersive experiences in 6G networks.
limitations: No immediate limitations are mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.Generative Video Semantic Communication: **GVSC** is a proposed framework for transmitting video information by focusing on semantic extraction and reconstruction using generative models, aiming for effective low-bandwidth usage.
new_terms.Diffusion models: **Diffusion models** are a class of generative models that progressively denoise data, allowing for the generation of new samples conditioned on specific inputs.
